question: In March I had a very mild heart attack.  At the same time I was diagnosed with pre-diabetes.  I am on Amaryl and metformin for the diabetes.  I am also on Carvedilol (coreg) and lisinopril for the heart.  I am also on simavastin (zocor) even though my total cholesterol at time of heart attach was 164.  I have done some investigating as to why my blood sugar readings seem to be so high and find that Carvedilol (coreg) and lisinopril can cause increases in blood glucose.  Are there any other drug(s) that can do the same job as Carvediloland lisinopril and keep my blood sugars under control.  I feel I am fighting a  losing battle.  Oh, I also eat a low carb high fiber diet.  I am also 5'2" and weigh 143 lbs. When I introduce  low GL fruits my numbers skyrocket.  Any help would be appreciated.  I see my doctor tomorrow and would like to have at lease some intelligent information.  Thank you
title: interaction of drugs
